intro: Ouratea fusiformis, commonly known as the slender ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in umbels, and are borne on short pedicels. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as undergrowth in tropical forests.
